meanings.definition: To kill a large number of people indiscriminately or cruelly.
meanings.sent1: The invaders massacred the villagers without mercy.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers massacred the enemy troops during the battle.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally massacred the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The storm massacred the fragile sandcastle on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The virus spread quickly and massacred the entire population of the town.

meanings.definition: To defeat an opponent decisively in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: The champion massacred his rival in the boxing match.
meanings.sent2: The team massacred their opponents in the soccer game.
meanings.sent3: The student massacred the math quiz with a perfect score.
meanings.sent4: The comedian massacred the audience with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece painting massacred all other entries in the competition.
